Field Detail

boundary

private java.lang.String boundary
http boundary, for the posting multipart post.

heads

private java.lang.String[] heads
local head within the multipart post, for each file. This is precalculated for all files, in case the upload is not chunked. The heads length are counted in the total upload size, to check that it is less than the maxChunkSize. tails are calculated once, as they depend not of the file position in the upload.

tails

private java.lang.String[] tails
same as heads, for the ... tail in the multipart post, for each file. But tails depend on the file position (the boundary is added to the last tail). So it's to be calculated by each function.

httpDataOut

private java.io.DataOutputStream httpDataOut
This stream is open by startRequest(long, boolean, int, boolean). It is closed by the cleanRequest() method.

See Also:
startRequest(long, boolean, int, boolean), cleanRequest(), getOutputStream()

sock

private java.net.Socket sock
The network socket where the bytes should be written.

httpDataIn

private java.io.BufferedReader httpDataIn
This stream allows the applet to get the server response. It is opened and closed as the httpDataOut.

sbHttpResponseBody

private java.lang.StringBuffer sbHttpResponseBody
This StringBuffer contains the body for the server response. That is: the server response without the http header. This the real functionnal response from the server application, that would be outputed, for instance, by any 'echo' PHP command.

beforeRequest

void beforeRequest(int firstFileToUploadParam,
                   int nbFilesToUploadParam)
             throws JUploadException
Description copied from class: DefaultFileUploadThread
This method is called before starting of each request. It can be used to prepare any work, before starting the request. For instance, in HTTP, the tail must be properly calculated, as the last one must be different from the others.

Specified by:

getAdditionnalBytesForUpload

long getAdditionnalBytesForUpload(int indexFile)
Description copied from class: DefaultFileUploadThread
This methods upload overhead for the file number indexFile in the filesDataParam given to the constructor. For instance, in HTTP, the upload contains a head and a tail for each files.

Specified by:
getAdditionnalBytesForUpload in class DefaultFileUploadThread
Parameters:
indexFile - The index of the file in the filesDataParam array, whose addtional length is asked.
Returns:
The additional number of bytes for this file.

startRequest

void startRequest(long contentLength,
                  boolean bChunkEnabled,
                  int chunkPart,
                  boolean bLastChunk)
            throws JUploadException
Description copied from class: DefaultFileUploadThread
This method is called for each upload request to the server. The number of request to the server depends on:
  • The total number of files to upload.
  • The value of the nbFilesPerRequest applet parameter.
  • The value of the maxChunkSize applet parameter.
    • The main objective of this method is to open the connection to the server, where the files to upload will be written. It should also send any header necessary for this upload request. The DefaultFileUploadThread.getOutputStream() methods is then called to know where the uploaded files should be written.
    Note: it's up to the class containing this method to internally manage the connection.

    Specified by:
    startRequest in class DefaultFileUploadThread
    Parameters:
    contentLength - The total number of bytes for the files (or the chunk) to upload in this query.
    bChunkEnabled - True if this upload is part of a file (can occurs only if the maxChunkSize applet parameter is set). False otherwise.
    chunkPart - The chunk number. Should be ignored if bChunkEnabled is false.
    bLastChunk - True if in chunk mode, and this upload is the last one. Should be ignored if bChunkEnabled is false.
    Throws:
    JUploadException
    See Also:
    DefaultFileUploadThread.startRequest(long, boolean, int, boolean)

    getRandomString

    private java.lang.String getRandomString()
    Construction of a random string, to separate the uploaded files, in the HTTP upload request.

    setAllHead

    private void setAllHead(int firstFileToUpload,
                        int nbFilesToUpload,
                        java.lang.String bound)
                 throws JUploadException
    Construction of the head for each file.

    Parameters:
    firstFileToUpload - The index of the first file to upload, in the DefaultFileUploadThread.filesToUpload area.
    nbFilesToUpload - Number of file to upload, in the next HTTP upload request. These files are taken from the DefaultFileUploadThread.filesToUpload area
    bound - The String boundary between the post data in the HTTP request.
    Throws:
    JUploadException

    setAllTail

    private void setAllTail(int firstFileToUpload,
                        int nbFilesToUpload,
                        java.lang.String bound)
    Construction of the tail for each file.

    Parameters:
    firstFileToUpload - The index of the first file to upload, in the DefaultFileUploadThread.filesToUpload area.
    nbFilesToUpload - Number of file to upload, in the next HTTP upload request. These files are taken from the DefaultFileUploadThread.filesToUpload area
    bound - Current boudnary, to apply for these tails.
